page.title: 13SOCIAL LIFE,CARSHALTON SRY.
page.content: Much social life these days revolves around the local inns. We interviewed the landlord of one of the Carshalton hostelries. He told us about his pub. In the six years he had been there he has made the two bars into one big one and opened up the garden, so that families can come with their children. They have fruit machines and one_armed bandits but no discos as they like to keep it as a family pub and therefore fairly quiet. There are 2 beer deliveries every week, and spirits once a fortnight. There are about 5OO drinking glasses in the pub and 8 full_time staff and lO part_time. Lager is the most popular drink in summer and in the winter bitter. Spirits also vary _ whisky is more popular in the winter. He sells somewhere between 8O or 9O different drinks, and a large range of foods.
